reviews.title: Worst customer service, Rude
reviews.text: Worst customer service at any hotel I've ever been. This hotel is definitely not used to having families stay there. I stayed with my wife, a toddler and a dog, and we received sneers and rude treatment from the day we checked in. They weren't very understanding of my wife having to take care of a dog and baby while I was attending a conference in Stuttgart. If your a single businessman, I sure this hotel would be okay, since that's all I saw stay there. I guess they didn't like our t-shirts and jeans when everyone else was in suits and ties. We've never felt so uncomfortable at a hotel, you couldn't pay me to stay there again!

This was our first hotel in Germany and we stayed for one night. We loved it! It was quite easy to find from the Hauptbahnhof and only a few blocks away from restaurants, shopping, and the other sights.
reviews.title: Great find, quiet neighborhood, easy access to everything
Smashing Hotel
reviews.text: They even let us check in early at 11 a.m. which was very nice and after we checked out they held our bags in a closet while we finished our touring. (The owner, who was great, even taught me the proper German way to ask if they'll store the luggage!)

The room was nicely decorated, nothing fancy, and it had an adequate bathroom. The shower was a bit odd, but I think that's because I'm American and not used to it. (No shower curtain, just a glass door that would swing and cover 1/3 of the bathtub. ?!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, awesome breakfast!

reviews.text: At night they have a little bar downstairs where you can have drinks with other guests. (They have beer on draft.) The Fruhstuck was amazing. A beautiful production with so many choices we were so excited!
reviews.title: Shop til You Drop
Staff very kind and helpful. Wonderful breakfast. Wonderful value.
reviews.text: I'd highly recommend this moderately priced hotel. I did give it 4 stars because for the price the decor was a bit outdated and old -- we stayed at some other hotels in the region that were updated and cheaper....just not in Stuttgart.

Close to the main station, the Schlossplatz and the main shopping street of Stuttgart, yet tucked away in a quiet, dead-end street on the sides of a hill (with vinyards), the Kronen Hotel offers excellent service, large rooms with great comfort (chaise longue, steam cabin) at good prices.
reviews.title: Stuttgart's best hotel - bar none

likes.disliked: — A steep walk up the hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always visit this hotel when away on business, and it's the perfect hotel for winding down and relaxing after a hard day's work.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Stuttgart

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Kronen Hotel in Stuttgart and would definitely recommend it to others. It is located quite close to the main train station but on a side street that is quiet. We booked a regular double room but were upgraded to a comfort room/suite that was nicely decorated, the bathroom actually had a whirlpoot bath, good television and comfortable bed. The breakfast offered by the hotel is truly outstanding, one of the best we have ever experienced in our travels.Definitely an excellent choice for Stuttgart.
reviews.title: Modest, very nice, great breakfast

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and were very happy with the Kronen. It is not far from the train station once you know the way. It is a bit of a walk to sites, which was a bit of a problem for us because it was very hot when we were in Stuttgart.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: But our room was very nice, clean and modern, and even had the most reasonable priced mini-bar I have ever encountered. Very helpful staff and a huge breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: does what it says on the tin!
